c74object.name: cnmatrix~
c74object.description: cnmatrix~ takes lists (like matrix~) or jitter matrices as input to set the gains. The rows of the matrix represent the outputs, and the columns are the inputs (same as matrixctl).

objarg.name: number of inputs
objarg.description: The first argument sets the number of inlets to create.

objarg.name: number of outputs
objarg.description: The second argument sets the number of outlets to create.

objarg.name: interpoation mode
objarg.description:
An optional third argument sets the interpoation mode. Options are:
smooth : (default) uses the same formula as slide~. Use this option for an audio mixer.
frame : linear interpolation over one signal vector. Use for equal power panning.
fast : no interpolation at all. Audible clicks may result. Use for static routing only.

method.name: jit_matrix
method.description: jitter matrix to set the gains. The rows of the matrix represent the outputs, and the columns are the inputs.

method.name: list
method.description:
Like matrix~, cnmatrix~ allows you to set connections between inlets and outlets using a list of three values: inlet_number outlet_number multiplier
For example the list: 0 1 0.5 would make a connection between the first inlet and the second outlet, with a multiplier of 0.5.

method.name: slide
method.description: the slide followed by a float value, sets the time in milliseconds it takes to interpolate between matrix connections in smooth mode.
